main event: A cigar-shaped object with a pointed nose and a blunt tail was observed in the sky near Alpena, Michigan on November 12, 1957.
interesting points: The object was heard before it was seen, making a sound described as between a hiss and a low tone.
The object flew at a much lower altitude than a typical low-flying aircraft.
The object flew a straight, unaltered course from west to east.
The object was observed for 12-15 seconds before disappearing into the distance.
There were no visible wings, stabilizers, or other mechanical protrusions on the object.
sighted object: cigar-shaped object with pointed nose and blunt tail
